pull.title: test: default acceptnonstdtxn=0 on all chains
pull.body: Changes `-acceptnonstxtxn` to default to 0 on testnet, matching the other chains. Allowing non-standard txs on testnet by default contributed to the difficulties RSK described in #26348: "We see that there are two script paths and, to reduce the script size, a single CHECKMULTISIG is used for the two paths, separating the signer count from the CHECKMULTISIG opcode. This script worked on testnet, because it lacks the standard checks performed in Mainnet."

events.message:
config: default acceptnonstdtxn=0 on all chains

Previously, the default for acceptnonstdtxn defaulted to 0 on all
chains except testnet. Change this to be consistent across all
chains, and remove the parameter from chainparams entirely.
doc: Release notes for testnet defaulting to -acceptnonstdtxn=0

events.body:
lgtm ACK 13eb8aa572644a53ae0d631916cb4cbc273a92d1

I think the pull request title should start with `policy: `, or `test: `, no?

rename.from: config: default acceptnonstdtxn=0 on all chains

comments.body:
```suggestion
    argsman.AddArg("-acceptnonstdtxn", strprintf("Relay and mine \"non-standard\" transactions (test networks only; default: %u)", DEFAULT_ACCEPT_NON_STD_TXN), ArgsManager::ALLOW_ANY | ArgsManager::DEBUG_ONLY, OptionsCategory::NODE_RELAY);
```
nit: Not sure if every test-only setting must enumerate all test-networks. Should be sufficient if `-chain` does it, no?
